items.sentence: It looked like you weren't having a good time.
I have to take the entrance examination today.
Never open the door of a car that's in motion.

Turn to page 30, and read the third paragraph.
Don't pay more for something than you need to.
That was the first thing I thought about, too.
I think it's necessary for you to talk to Tom.
Come to see me at any time tomorrow afternoon.
You're the only one who really understands me.
I hope we don't have problems like this again.
Tom insisted that we stay there until the end.
Making friends with foreigners is interesting.
It rained heavily, so the playground is muddy.
I have no choice but to accept your proposals.
The potato was so hot that it burned my mouth.
Tom was able to do everything he wanted to do.
Tom has had his fair share of problems lately.
I liked Tom's first book more than the second.
Tom resolved to stop calling himself an idiot.
God forbid that anything should happen to Tom.

Tom took little sips of the piping hot coffee.

Tom called Mary to tell her that he was sorry.
Tom thought he was destined for bigger things.
Tom is back in Boston, working for his father.

Any time you need something, just let me know.
Did you live in Australia when you were a kid?
Did you get to do everything you wanted to do?

If there are any problems, please let me know.

I'll miss Tom, and I think he'll miss me, too.
I didn't buy any Christmas presents this year.

Getting a driving licence would make me happy.
American films are popular all over the world.
Tom won't likely be the last student to leave.
Tom will probably be the first one to wake up.

Students in Tom's old high school bullied him.

What you did is probably going to impress Tom.

Many accidents were caused by the bad weather.

I don't have enough money to buy anything now.
We ought to do something about this situation.
Which one do you prefer, this one or that one?
I didn't really feel like eating Chinese food.
Tom wasn't really sick, but he called in sick.
Tom said that he was too sick to come to work.
Tom will be on the same train that I'll be on.

I'd rather do that tomorrow. Would that be OK?

I'm not surprised Tom doesn't want to do that.

I wish I didn't have to go to Boston tomorrow.

I think that it might be difficult to do that.

Tom often write articles for travel magazines.

I didn't mean to imply what you did was wrong.
